thread.title: SEC Lawyer Scott Friestad, Bedridden With Cancer, Kept Working Until His Final Days

author: James R. Hagerty
title: SEC Lawyer Scott Friestad, Bedridden With Cancer, Kept Working Until His Final Days
text:
For the last several months of his life, as he was dying of cancer, Scott Friestad was mostly confined to bed and unable to go into his office in Washington at the Securities and Exchange Commission. So Mr. Friestad worked from bed, advising his colleagues on matters he was overseeing as an associate director of the agencyâ€™s enforcement division. Having only recently retired his BlackBerry, he relied on an iPhone.
The SEC is often a temporary stop for lawyers who then go into private practice, frequently to defend corporations...
